00002 * $Id$          dac_wave_generate.c                             2010-07-16
00003 */
00026 #include "lpc17xx_dac.h"
00027 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"
00028 #include "lpc17xx_pinsel.h"
00029 #include "lpc17xx_gpdma.h"
00030 #include "debug_frmwrk.h"
00031 
00032 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00038 /************************** PRIVATE MACROS *************************/
00040 #define DMA_SIZE_SINE           60
00041 #define NUM_SAMPLE_SINE         60
00042 #define DMA_SIZE                        64
00043 #define NUM_SAMPLE                      64
00044 
00045 #define SIGNAL_FREQ_IN_HZ       60
00046 #define PCLK_DAC_IN_MHZ 25 //CCLK divided by 4
00047 
00048 #define DAC_GENERATE_SINE               1
00049 #define DAC_GENERATE_TRIANGLE   2
00050 #define DAC_GENERATE_ESCALATOR  3
00051 #define DAC_GENERATE_NONE               0
00052 
00053 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00054 uint8_t menu1[] =
00055 "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00056 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00057 " DAC generate signals demo \n\r"
00058 "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00059 "\t - Core: ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r"
00060 "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200 kbps \n\r"
00061 " Use DAC to generate sine, triangle, escalator wave, frequency adjustable\n\r"
00062 " Signal samples are transmitted to DAC by DMA memory to peripheral\n\r"
00063 "********************************************************************************\n\r";
00064 
00065 /************************** PRIVATE FUNCTION *************************/
00066 void print_menu(void);
00067 
00068 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00069 /*********************************************************************/
00074 void print_menu(void)
00075 {
00076         _DBG(menu1);
00077 }
00078 
00079 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00080 /*********************************************************************/
00085 int c_entry(void)
00086 {
00087         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00088         DAC_CONVERTER_CFG_Type DAC_ConverterConfigStruct;
00089         GPDMA_Channel_CFG_Type GPDMACfg;
00090         GPDMA_LLI_Type DMA_LLI_Struct;
00091         uint32_t tmp;
00092         uint8_t i,option;
00093         uint32_t sin_0_to_90_16_samples[16]={\
00094                         0,1045,2079,3090,4067,\
00095                         5000,5877,6691,7431,8090,\
00096                         8660,9135,9510,9781,9945,10000\
00097         };
00098         uint32_t dac_lut[NUM_SAMPLE];
00099 
00100         /*
00101          * Init DAC pin connect
00102          * AOUT on P0.26
00103          */
00104         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00105         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00106         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00107         PinCfg.Pinnum = 26;
00108         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00109         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00110 
00111         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00112          * – 115200bps
00113          * – 8 data bit
00114          * – No parity
00115          * – 1 stop bit
00116          * – No flow control
00117          */
00118         debug_frmwrk_init();
00119 
00120         // print welcome screen
00121         print_menu();
00122 
00123         while(1)
00124         {
00125                 //Select option
00126                 _DBG("Please choose signal type:\n\r");
00127                 _DBG("\t1) Sine wave.\n\r");
00128                 _DBG("\t2) Triangle wave.\n\r");
00129                 _DBG("\t3) Escalator wave.\n\r");
00130                 option = DAC_GENERATE_NONE;
00131                 while(option == DAC_GENERATE_NONE)
00132                 {
00133                         switch(_DG)
00134                         {
00135                         case '1': option = DAC_GENERATE_SINE; break;
00136                         case '2': option = DAC_GENERATE_TRIANGLE; break;
00137                         case '3': option = DAC_GENERATE_ESCALATOR; break;
00138                         default:
00139                                 _DBG("Wrong choice! Please select 1 or 2 or 3 only!\n\r");
00140                                 option = DAC_GENERATE_NONE;
00141                                 break;
00142                         }
00143                 }
00144 
00145                 //Prepare DAC look up table
00146                 switch(option)
00147                 {
00148                 case DAC_GENERATE_SINE:
00149                         for(i=0;i<NUM_SAMPLE_SINE;i++)
00150                         {
00151                                 if(i<=15)
00152                                 {
00153                                         dac_lut[i] = 512 + 512*sin_0_to_90_16_samples[i]/10000;
00154                                         if(i==15) dac_lut[i]= 1023;
00155                                 }
00156                                 else if(i<=30)
00157                                 {
00158                                         dac_lut[i] = 512 + 512*sin_0_to_90_16_samples[30-i]/10000;
00159                                 }
00160                                 else if(i<=45)
00161                                 {
00162                                         dac_lut[i] = 512 - 512*sin_0_to_90_16_samples[i-30]/10000;
00163                                 }
00164                                 else
00165                                 {
00166                                         dac_lut[i] = 512 - 512*sin_0_to_90_16_samples[60-i]/10000;
00167                                 }
00168                                 dac_lut[i] = (dac_lut[i]<<6);
00169                         }
00170                         break;
00171                 case DAC_GENERATE_TRIANGLE:
00172                         for(i=0;i<NUM_SAMPLE;i++)
00173                         {
00174                                 if(i<32) dac_lut[i]= 32*i;
00175                                 else if (i==32) dac_lut[i]= 1023;
00176                                 else dac_lut[i] = 32*(NUM_SAMPLE-i);
00177                                 dac_lut[i] = (dac_lut[i]<<6);
00178                         }
00179                         break;
00180                 case DAC_GENERATE_ESCALATOR:
00181                         for(i=0;i<NUM_SAMPLE;i++)
00182                         {
00183                                 dac_lut[i] = (1023/3)*(i/16);
00184                                 dac_lut[i] = (dac_lut[i]<<6);
00185                         }
00186                         break;
00187                 default: break;
00188                 }
00189 
00190                 //Prepare DMA link list item structure
00191                 DMA_LLI_Struct.SrcAddr= (uint32_t)dac_lut;
00192                 DMA_LLI_Struct.DstAddr= (uint32_t)&(LPC_DAC->DACR);
00193                 DMA_LLI_Struct.NextLLI= (uint32_t)&DMA_LLI_Struct;
00194                 DMA_LLI_Struct.Control= ((option==DAC_GENERATE_SINE)?DMA_SIZE_SINE:DMA_SIZE)
00195                                                                 | (2<<18) //source width 32 bit
00196                                                                 | (2<<21) //dest. width 32 bit
00197                                                                 | (1<<26) //source increment
00198                                                                 ;
00199 
00200 
00201                 /* GPDMA block section -------------------------------------------- */
00202                 /* Initialize GPDMA controller */
00203                 GPDMA_Init();
00204 
00205                 // Setup GPDMA channel --------------------------------
00206                 // channel 0
00207                 GPDMACfg.ChannelNum = 0;
00208                 // Source memory
00209                 GPDMACfg.SrcMemAddr = (uint32_t)(dac_lut);
00210                 // Destination memory - unused
00211                 GPDMACfg.DstMemAddr = 0;
00212                 // Transfer size
00213                 GPDMACfg.TransferSize = ((option==DAC_GENERATE_SINE)?DMA_SIZE_SINE:DMA_SIZE);
00214                 // Transfer width - unused
00215                 GPDMACfg.TransferWidth = 0;
00216                 // Transfer type
00217                 GPDMACfg.TransferType = GPDMA_TRANSFERTYPE_M2P;
00218                 // Source connection - unused
00219                 GPDMACfg.SrcConn = 0;
00220                 // Destination connection
00221                 GPDMACfg.DstConn = GPDMA_CONN_DAC;
00222                 // Linker List Item - unused
00223                 GPDMACfg.DMALLI = (uint32_t)&DMA_LLI_Struct;
00224                 // Setup channel with given parameter
00225                 GPDMA_Setup(&GPDMACfg);
00226 
00227                 DAC_ConverterConfigStruct.CNT_ENA =SET;
00228                 DAC_ConverterConfigStruct.DMA_ENA = SET;
00229                 DAC_Init(LPC_DAC);
00230                 /* set time out for DAC*/
00231                 tmp = (PCLK_DAC_IN_MHZ*1000000)/(SIGNAL_FREQ_IN_HZ*((option==DAC_GENERATE_SINE)?NUM_SAMPLE_SINE:NUM_SAMPLE));
00232                 DAC_SetDMATimeOut(LPC_DAC,tmp);
00233                 DAC_ConfigDAConverterControl(LPC_DAC, &DAC_ConverterConfigStruct);
00234 
00235                 //Start the demo
00236                 switch(option)
00237                 {
00238                 case DAC_GENERATE_SINE:
00239                         _DBG("\n\rDAC is generating 60Hz sine wave...");
00240                         break;
00241                 case DAC_GENERATE_TRIANGLE:
00242                         _DBG("\n\rDAC is generating 60Hz triangle wave...");
00243                         break;
00244                 case DAC_GENERATE_ESCALATOR:
00245                         _DBG("\n\rDAC is generating 60Hz escalator wave...");
00246                         break;
00247                 default: break;
00248                 }
00249 
00250                 // Enable GPDMA channel 0
00251                 GPDMA_ChannelCmd(0, ENABLE);
00252 
00253                 _DBG_("\n\rPreass ESC if you want to terminate!");
00254                 while(_DG!=27);
00255 
00256                 // Disable GPDMA channel 0
00257                 GPDMA_ChannelCmd(0, DISABLE);
00258 
00259         }
00260         return 1;
00261 }
00262 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00263    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00264    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00265    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00266    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00267 int main(void)
00268 {
00269     return c_entry();
00270 }

00277 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
